title: Six People Escape from Mobile Home Fire in Hendersonville
content:
HENDERSON COUNTY, N.C. -- Six people, including a baby, escaped a fire in Hendersonville on Monday. 

Landlord Don Middleton says a grease fire broke out at a mobile home in Alpine Woods when a tenant left food on the stove. 

The flames spread through the kitchen and into the trailer's ceiling. 

Middleton says this isn't the first time this family has dealt with a fire. 

"This is the second time for this family to have a fire here at Alpine. The first trailer burnt and they moved into the trailer they're in now," Middleton said. 

No one was hurt. 

The Red Cross is helping the family.
